definition: to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
kind/type/class/category/similar/like/to resemble
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: In this way, when can we judge the whole ancient books to read, comprehend by analogy.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，閱讀古書時才能舉一反三，觸類旁通。

sentences.english: If you understand this point, you can understand the rest by analogy.
sentences.chinese: 如果懂得這點，其它的就可以觸類旁通了。

sentences.english: Finally, choose partial target system to make case analysis in order to understand by analogy.
sentences.chinese: 選擇了部分指標體系進行了案例分析，以求觸類旁通。

sentences.english: However, painting and music to some extent can also be comprehended similarly.
sentences.chinese: 然而繪畫與音樂在某種程度上又是觸類旁通的。

definition: different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
self-taught/to learn without a teacher (idiom)
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
to give instructions/to give advice
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to comment/to evaluate
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
shameful performance/disgraceful situation
sequel/continuation of a book
to review the old and know the new (idiom, from the Analects)/to recall the past to understand the future
shortcoming/defect/fault/one's weak points
